item.title: 12 Tools To Unsleash Your Creativity
item.description: 12 Tools: Sameness / Difference Connecting Relating Analogizing Zooming In & Zooming Out Perspectiving Engineering Conditions Categorizing and Un-categorizing Inverting Cause and Effect in your life Stylizing Connecting the tools^ (and connecting the connections^ of the tools, … and so on) Credit: Eben Pagan

item.title: Adversity Quotient
item.description: The Adversity Quotient tries to be a measurement of one’s perseverence and success in face of adversity. [!quote] In face of adversity

item.title: Coaching
item.description: Differentiating Coaching In trying to define the field of coaching, it is useful to take a look at that which it is not.

item.title: Coaching Models
item.description: Coaching models help the coach to structure coaching conversations, and also serve as a tool to communicate to the client:

item.title: Commonplace Book
item.description: Software Examples Obsidian.md OneNote Notion Roam Research Devon Think What to look for in software: ability to connect and link notes, structure, good search feature, text editing, tables, … (mobile app) This also helps feed your pattern recognition, curiosity, and thus feeds creativity, Flow, and skill building.

item.title: Creativity
item.description: What is it? .. the workings of creativity are the workings of the world. Creativity and Flow go together. How to be Creative For starters, a clear intention to be creative helps.

item.title: Distraction
item.description: Distractions are defined relative to where we would need to place our attention and focus in order to fulfill our needs and get a certain result we want.

item.title: Ego Development Theory (EDT)
item.description: A developmental psychology model by researcher Susanne Cook-Greuter, build upon and expanded the previous work on Jane Loevinger. Nine Stages of Ego Development Pre-Conventional

item.title: Flow
How to become more Charismatic
item.description: Three essential characteristics of charismatic people: Presence Power Warmth Some views on Charisma [!important] Make a mental note!

item.title: Inner Game
item.description: The Inner Game model was developed and popularized by Timothy Gallway with his book “The Inner Game of Tennis”. He makes a case for self-talk and self-image separating the poor players from the great.

item.title: Learning from the History of Innovation
item.description: Which seven elements help understand the history of innovation? {Book: Where Good Ideas Come From} The Adjacent Possible Liquid Networks The Slow Hunch Serendipity Error Exaptation Platforms
